description: Classic looks, V8 power, and an affordable price – this 1967 Ford Mustang embodies everything you love about this iconic American coupe.

Acapulco Blue is a terrific color because the name instantly takes your mind to winding roads driving along a clear blue ocean.  So the 1967-correct hue gives this car distinction while also promoting the open-road freedom that the first-generation Mustang is all about.  And the in fact, the '67 is an icon all on its own.  This is the year that the car was adapted to what the market really wanted.  So they made the body a little longer and more aggressive, but it still retained everything you love – from the running pony grille to the triple-element taillights.  So you get more muscle without corrupting the formula that makes this the quintessential American classic.  And this upgraded sporty attitude is turned up further by pieces like the triple rocker stripe and torque thrust style wheels.

The black bucket seat interior retains a highly original presentation.  Even the original AM radio is still on display! But elements like the newer carpeting and floor mats keep the right places feeling fresh.  Plus, the darkness of this is broken up nicely by brighter elements like the dash, gearshift, and wood rimmed steering wheel.  The '67 cars were also the debut of upgrades like an armrest on the center console and a larger gauge package, so this is also an improved driver's machine.

Under the hood is more great period-correct presentation.  The 289 cubic-inch V8's bright blue block and intake radiate from within the glossy black the engine bay.  Plus, the bright valve covers and air toper add some extra distinction.  But your favorite shiny piece should be the aluminum radiator – it tells you this one knows how to keep cool going down the road.  A newer coil and alternator help with this reliable total package, too.  Add in the three-speed automatic transmission, and you've got a classic Mustang that's ready for cruising.
This iconic pony car is ready for cruising, and at this price, you know it will be leaving our stable soon.  Call today!!!
1967 Mustang Coupe Road Race Car

This 1967 Mustang started as a clean title T code 6 cyl car  and was built to be a fun reliable track car for club days or DE/ Time trial events. All steel body, doors gutted, Legal competition NASA certified cage,  front and rear lexan glass and removable door glass for transport.
This 1967  Mustang Race Car is properly documented including NASA logbook, Specs and receipts.
Looking to Trade for a C5 Vette, 2005+ Mustang or 98-02 LS Camaro or Pontiac Road race car.
Would also consider any other Interesting American Road race cars.
See specs below:
Engine-
351 Windsor stroked to 408 cubic inch with an Eagle rotating assembly kit
385 RWHP  435RWTQ @ 6000rpm

750 Holley
MSD ignition
oil cooler

Mac shorty headers w 2.5" exhaust Flow master Mufflers

Ram clutch
Aluminum drive shaft
9" Strange engineering sportsman Center Sectrion 3.50 gear with 31 spline Detroit locker
Front Brakes - 13.5 " Brembo 4 piston caliper with vented Brembo rotors. Hawk pads
Rear Brakes - 12" .825 rotor with Willwood 4 piston uni lite calipers Willwood pads
Front Suspension - Stock upper A arms Modified to roller bearing inner shafts and pro motorsport neg wedge ball joints. Shelby 1" relocation of mounting point
70 mustang spindles
Global west lower arms
QA 1 Aluminum double adjustable coil over shocks mounted thru
upper arm lower mount on lower control arm. 475lb springs
1 1/8 front sway bar
Flaming river rack and pinion
Rear suspension - Coleman IMCA lightweight rear housing with 31 spline axles  Stock car floating  mounts Cobra Automotive road race rear springs with slider box rear mount.
All star 3rd link spring snubbed. QA 1 90 10 brake snubbing shock. Koni  adjustable rear shocks.

Car has Auto-meter gauges, MSD 6 ignition, Fuel cell, Accusump system, Fire extinguisher System, Cobra Automotive alum seat. Now has a set of black 17" Torque Thrust wheels and 275/40/17 "Rain" tires on.
Offered For Sale by The California Automobile Museum
1967 Ford Mustang
We Offer Financing
This puppy's on steroids! Mustang with 347 Stroker motor!

Engine and transmission:  Less than 100 miles on rebuilt 347 Stroker motor with forged rods, Hyper Technic pistons, cam, 750 Holley carb on Edelbrock manifold, 15/16” heads, headers. Electronic ignition. Powered through T-5 five speed transmission rebuilt 300 miles ago with new clutch and throwout bearings. Radiator from 428 Mustang.
Suspension: Lowered suspension with front disc brakes.
Interior: New interior in 2006, Recaro front bucket seats from 1984 Mustang. No heater, fan works, needs heater core. Radio doesn't work. Needs gas sending unit.
Exterior: Repainted factory red in 2004 with single stage enamel. Paint presents well at 10 feet. No dents. One rust spot inside fender inner structure. Rear deck lid spoiler and front spoiler.
This Mustang has great stance and growl. Plant yourself in the driver seat and enjoy the ride!

For sale in our Nashville showroom is a beautiful 1967 Ford Mustang. This is a gorgeous example of the iconic pony car that is still popular today. It has a I6 engine that is paired with a 3 speed automatic transmission and is a real pleasure to drive. The exterior of this 67 Mustang for sale is coated in a beautiful light blue paint that looks as good as the day it was first put on. The wire wheels wrapped in white wall radial tires and the beautiful chrome trim give this Ford Mustang for sale that nostalgic air of a time capsule. The interior in this Mustang for sale is a beautifully maintained black vinyl that begs you to take the family out for a drive down old backroads without any phones or tablets or other distractions. It even has an updated sound system so you can better listen to those old favorites from yesteryear. And as you cruise along you get to share a little bit of the past with everyone who sees this beautiful 1967 Ford Mustang for sale. Options include: hub caps power steering seat belts AM/FM radio CD player aluminum wheels and radial white wall tires. For more information please call us at the Nashville showroom at 615-213-1800 or email us at
[Email Dealer]

This 1967 Red Mustang 390 is 1 of 500 built in 1967.  They stopped building them with this engine due to then weight of this engine.  4 Barrell Holly, Crager wheels and much more.  This car just needs some further interior attention and the person that would have the time to do it.  If you are familiar with this Mustang, you know it is worth your time and effort.

There are still lots of great early Mustangs out there for not a lot of cash, just like this 1967 Mustang coupe. It's a real C-code 289 V8 car, it's got the right colors, and it's available for about the price of a garden-variety daily driver. Wouldn't you rather have the Mustang?

Go to a show today and you might be convinced that the roads were teeming with Shelbys and Mach 1s, but the truth is, this coupe is far more accessible and looks much more like what people were driving in 1967. The handsome Springtime Yellow paint is certainly eye-catching, and there aren't many folks alive today who don't crack a smile when they see an early Mustang like this. Obviously kept in a warm, dry climate, this super-straight old pony wears that burgundy paint in a subtle way, so it makes a statement without the need for spoilers, which always seem to get in the way of the Mustang's clean, honest look. Good panel alignment certainly helps and 1967's quarter panel inserts are far more interesting than the early cars' plain ones. The black stripe along the rockers is recent and it works rather well with the black vinyl top, which is likewise in great shape. We like the look because it combines an elegant, upscale image with just enough street fighter to make everyone respect it on the road.

Mustangs were always equipped with wonderful, stylish, highly functional interiors, and this coupe is no exception. Bucket seats were standard (yes, you could get a bench in a Mustang, but why?) but these are aftermarket units that are far more supportive and aggressively bolstered than the originals. There's a big three-spoke steering wheel that works well in the Mustang's updated driver's compartment and it gives you great road feel. Round gauges covering the basics fill the dash and are probably original, the factory A/C still blows cold, and the shifter has a wooden handle that helps with the upscale vibe. The door panels, carpets, and headliner are all in good shape, and for entertainment it features a Sony AM/FM/CD stereo head unit. The trunk is neatly finished with a correct plaid mat as well as a spare tire with its own matching cover.

Yes, this is a real c-code 289/2-barrel car and it sticks to the original recipe for reliability and ease of maintenance. It's detailed with bright Ford Blue engine enamel and simple stamped valve covers but a chrome air cleaner gives it a bit of a racy look. The A/C compressor dominates the engine bay, but underneath it, you'll spot factory power steering that makes this pony a car you could drive every day. The C4 3-speed automatic transmission offers crisp shifting and someone has just added a brand new dual exhaust system in place of the original single exhaust, and the soundtrack is much better now. The front suspension is stock, but that's OK because it works well, and the floors are in good order. Period Cragar mags are a great addition, looking sporty without being too modern, and they're fitted with a recent set of blackwall radials.
Easy to live with, fun to drive, and affordable to buy, that's how the Mustang has always been great. If you like driving, this cool coupe is an excellent choice. Call today!

Rarely do you get to find a classic pony car that's also a survivor.  But this 1967 Ford Mustang is so original, we even believe the A-code V8 is from the factory.  So you're looking at a standout coupe for quite a nice price.

Burnt Amber is this Mustang's original color, and today the hue represents 1967 perfectly.  This sets up for a head-turning appearance because so many of these Mustangs have traded in their roots for wild new colors.  But this one goes in the opposite direction, and in fact, it's believed to be the original paint that the San Jose factory applied in January 1967.  That's what makes this one so exciting.  The presentation is not perfect, but don't be surprised if this is the one to draw the true enthusiasts at events.  After all, while many pony cars have gone through plenty of changes over the decades, this one has a half-century under good care that has kept this coupe complete, bright, and exceptionally straight – right down to the styled steel wheels with the Mustang logo in the middle.

One of the best colors to go with the golden hue exterior is the parchment interior.  Just like the exterior, we're hard pressed to find anything that didn't come directly from the factory.  Careful maintenance means the seats, dash, and door panels remain complete.  The right details are still in place like the deluxe steering wheel; the heat/defrost sliders still work; and even the factory AM radio is still cranking out tunes.  The revised '67 gauge panel still shows large and clear readouts, so this survivor is also easy to enjoy out on the road.

Lift hood for more great originality.  It's a correct 289 cubic-inch V8 that has resisted any shiny add-ons.  Instead, you get the correct bold blue presentation of the block, valve covers, and air topper.  While the preserved presentation means most people will never even have to ask if its original, the date code on this V8 puts it so close that it's hard to imagine any other V8 ever being in this engine bay.  Plus, this one has the optional and desirable A-code 289, and it still wears a Holley four-barrel carb today! Because this is a cared for survivor, the V8 fires up easily and feels smooth out on the road.  Plus, with three-speed automatic transmission, power steering, and front disc brakes, this is a great cruiser.
You're looking at the perfect time capsule that can be easily shown off everywhere.  The only real unbelievable part about this Mustang is its affordable price.  Don't miss out, call today!!!
1967 Ford Mustang

matching numbers, fully restored , clean Maryland title and ready for a new home.  1967 never looked better!   Freshly painted, new dash-interior seats, brand new rims with Bridgestone red-line tires.   Engine and transmission all re-built along with entire brake system. Rust-Free and Ready to cruise into the next 50-years of turning heads and making smiles. Happy motoring

The Atlanta Showroom is offering this 1967 Ford Mustang.  The inline six on this pony car is owner stated original and the original bill of sale from Mitchell Howell Ford in Virginia is available to the next owner.  This Mustang came with a black vinyl roof cruise-o-matic S/S 695X14 tires AM radio wire wheel covers and front and rear floor mats for an additional option cost of $446.77.  This pony has AC now to keep you cool in the hot summer months when you are enjoying your stang around town or going to the show.  The 1967 Ford Mustang was the first time since its beginning to be significantly changed. It was similar to its original style but just bigger. The grille features a larger opening and the feature lines on the side led to larger simulated air scoops. The taillight were three vertical lenses on each side of a concave panel and the gas cap was located in the center of the panel. About seven percent of the 1967 mustangs had the four-speed manual transmission 98 percent had bucket seats 15 percent had vinyl tops 16 percent had air conditioning and a rare feature was the dual exhaust found on about 25000 cars. Options include: AC wire wheels radial tires. This To view the car in greater detail including 100+ HD photos and HD video please visit www.gatewayclassiccars.com. For more information please call the Atlanta showroom at 678-894-4833!
